Package slotmachine.model.slots

Interface Wheel

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    WheelImpl
    public interface Wheel
    Supporting interface used in the Further Programming Assignment

    This interface should be implemented as WheelImpl.

    Each Wheel object represents one of the three wheels of the Slot Machine.

    Each Wheel has 3 visible slots; centre, top and bottom. Each Wheel can be turned, advancing to the next slot, using nextSlot()

    The class should have no visible constructor (must be private) and should provide the following method to support the creation of a Wheel 

     public static Wheel createWheel(int wheelNum)

    To aid testing/marking your class should also provide the following method (which should be be called be the one above). This methods should generate a List of SlotItem containing 100 slots based on the SlotItem.getCount() for each SlotItem value. The returned List should be of a random order of slots and should be unmodifiable. 

     public static List<SlotItem> generateSlots()
    Author:
    Ross Nye
    See Also:
    SlotItem, List

      • nextSlot

        Wheel nextSlot()
        This method turns the Wheel one slot.

        A turn is defined a advancing the slots of a wheel one position. An new (unseen) slot item will appear as the top of the wheel. The slot previously at the top moves to the centre and the previous centre slot moves to the bottom. The previous bottom slot is not longer visible.

        Returns:
        the same wheel object (with its state updated).

      • toString

        java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a String representing the Wheel in format shown in the two examples below and seen in the output trace. 
         Wheel #1: 3          / 5          / Silver Bar
 
         Wheel #3: Berry      / 3          / 3
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        a String representing the Wheel
